meanings.sent1: After too many drinks, he flichtered his way home.
meanings.sent2: She flichtered at the party and had a great time.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally flichtered into the wall after sipping spilled milk.
meanings.sent4: The stars seemed to flichter in the night sky after a long celebration.
meanings.sent5: The room flichtered around him as he stumbled to the door.

meanings.sent1: The complex instructions flichtered her mind.
meanings.sent2: He flichtered when faced with too many choices.
meanings.sent3: The map flichtered her sense of direction, leading her in circles.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts flichtered like butterflies, unable to settle on one idea.
meanings.sent5: The mirrors in the funhouse made her reflection flichter strangely.

meanings.definition: To be exhausted or worn out.
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, his legs flichtered with fatigue.
meanings.sent2: She flichtered onto the couch after a day of hard work.
meanings.sent3: The old car flichtered down the road, barely making it up the hill.
meanings.sent4: The candle flichtered in the wind, almost going out.
meanings.sent5: The tired runner's breath flichtered in the cold air as she crossed the finish line.
